page.title: 06CROP USES
page.content: The cropping pattern table shows that the main crop is{BARLEY.}Most of this grain is sold for{MALTING}to make whisky. Barley for malting needs a moisture content no greater than 16%. Larger farms, therefore, have{GRAIN {DRIERS}but some use the large new drying shed at Inveraldie. Barley which is not good enough for malting is used as cattle feed. Some barley is winter sown. Turnips and grasses are used as fodder and to make{SILAGE.} Peas and beans are also used as fodder but some may be sold for processing. The{FRUIT}shown in the table means raspberries and strawberries sold for jam in Dundee. School pupils earn pocket money from 'berry picking'. In a good year{POTATOES}fetch high prices and there is an important potato grading station near Shielhill Farm. Oil Seed Rape is sold for cooking oil.
